revisions.*:
'''Brewer Phillips''' (November 16, 1924 – August 30, 1999)<ref name="Dead"/> was an [[United States|American]] [[blues]] [[guitarist]], chiefly associated with [[Juke joint blues]] and [[Chicago blues]].

Phillips was born in [[Coila, Mississippi]], [[United States]], on a [[plantation]] and learned the blues from [[Memphis Minnie]] at an early age.<ref name="AMG">{{cite web |url={{Allmusic|class=artist|id=pbrewer-phillips-p114212|biography|pure_url=yes}}|title=Brewer Phillips|author= |publisher=[[Allmusic]] |accessdate=November 9, 2011}}</ref> He relocated to [[Memphis, Tennessee|Memphis]] and played with [[Bill Harvey]], [[Roosevelt Sykes]], and [[Hound Dog Taylor]]. Following Taylor's death in 1976, Phillips recorded under his own name, as well as playing with [[J. B. Hutto]], [[Lil' Ed Williams]], and [[Cub Koda]] amongst others.<ref name="AMG"/> He performed on both acoustic and electric guitar, and recorded for [[Delmark Records]] and [[JSP Records]].

Phillips died of [[death by natural causes|natural causes]] in [[Chicago]], [[Illinois]], in August 1999, at the age of 74.<ref name="Dead">[http://thedeadrockstarsclub.com/1998.html Thedeadrockstarsclub.com - accessed February 2010]</ref><ref name="AMG"/>

==Discography==
*''Whole Lotta Blues'' ([[JSP Records]])
*''Homebrew'' ([[Delmark Records]], 1996)
*'' Well Alright'' (Black Rose) 2008
